txt.en: 'Ah, thank you, [placeholder]! What a kind soul you must be, to help the foolish people here in Galtrev.\n\n'Once, I might have been able to show you proper hospitality. Now, alas, all I can offer you is friendship, little though it is worth.'
A Heavy Task
Dropped the box
'If I lift another box, I fear my back will give out completely....'
The package for Isengard has been delivered to the Overseer
'If I lift another box, I fear my back will give out completely....'
Dropped the box
The first Overseer is at the worksite near the western gate of Galtrev.\n\nYou should carry the first shipment to the Overseer.
'If I lift another box, I fear my back will give out completely....'
The package for Isengard has been delivered to the Overseer
The second Overseer is at the worksite slightly up the hill from the first.\n\nYou should carry the first shipment to the second Overseer.
'If I lift another box, I fear my back will give out completely....'
Dropped the box
The third Overseer is at the worksite just uphill and to the south from the second worksite.\n\nYou should carry the first shipment to the third Overseer.
The package for Isengard has been delivered to the Overseer
Ruthless Tom guards the west gate.\n\nYou should carry the shipment to Ruthless Tom.
Dropped the box
Gethin can be found recovering from a long day's work near the fourth worksite.\n\nYou should return to Gethin and tell him that all of the boxes have been successfully delivered.
The package for Isengard has been delivered to the guard
Deliver the first box of supplies to the first worksite's Overseer
Deliver the second box of supplies to the second worksite's Overseer
Deliver the third box of supplies to the third worksite's Overseer
Deliver the fourth box of supplies to the guard at the west gate
Talk to Gethin at the fourth worksite
Do not drop the box
Deliver the fourth box of supplies to the guard at the west gate
Do not drop the box
Talk to Gethin at the fourth worksite
Gethin is an old man, and no longer has the strength to lift the boxes he has been charged with delivering.

'Are you a visitor here in Galtrev? I wish you could have seen it before -- it was the greatest village in all of Dunland! Now it is naught but a labour camp for the White Hand.\n\n'But all the working men have gone, or perhaps they were taken. The old and the women are left to bear heavy burdens. For myself, I cannot even lift the boxes I am supposed to carry. I am much too slow for this, and I am always falling behind....'
